member.name: COMSTAT
member.summary: Contains information about a communications device. This structure is filled by the function.

member.name: COMSTAT.fCtsHold
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, transmission is waiting for the CTS (clear-to-send) signal to be sent.

member.name: COMSTAT.fDsrHold
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, transmission is waiting for the DSR (data-set-ready) signal to be sent.

member.name: COMSTAT.fRlsdHold
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, transmission is waiting for the RLSD (receive-line-signal-detect) signal to be sent.

member.name: COMSTAT.fXoffHold
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, transmission is waiting because the XOFF character was received.

member.name: COMSTAT.fXoffSent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, transmission is waiting because the XOFF character was transmitted. (Transmission halts when the XOFF character is transmitted to a system that takes the next character as XON, regardless of the actual character.)

member.name: COMSTAT.fEof
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the end-of-file (EOF) character has been received.

member.name: COMSTAT.fTxim
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, there is a character queued for transmission that has come to the communications device by way of the function. The communications device transmits such a character ahead of other characters in the device's output buffer.

member.name: COMSTAT.cbInQue
member.summary: The number of bytes received by the serial provider but not yet read by a operation.

member.name: COMSTAT.cbOutQue
member.summary: The number of bytes of user data remaining to be transmitted for all write operations. This value will be zero for a nonoverlapped write.
